commits.commit_title:
Fix addresses being represented as uintptr_t

As of commit f3c8d248a198 ("Make Addr a u64") all addresses were
supposed to be represented as 64 bit integers. However, that changed did
not adjust the C API bindings. Usually that would have been picked up
transparently in the C header, except that cbindgen required us to
explicitly specify the address type, leading to a mismatch. Fix it up.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_output *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_opts(const blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                     uint32_t pid,
                                                                     const uint64_t *addrs,
                                                                     size_t addr_cnt,
                                                                     const struct blaze_normalize_opts *opts);

commits.commit_title:
Introduce normalize::NormalizerOpts

We may reasonably want to make normalization more customizable in the
future. To make that possible without an exponential explosion of new
variant methods on the normalizer, this change introduces an option type
that is to be passed to the method used for address normalization.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_output *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_opts(const blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                     uint32_t pid,
                                                                     const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                     size_t addr_cnt,
                                                                     const struct blaze_normalize_opts *opts);

commits.commit_title:
Reorder pid argument in normalization APIs

The pid argument in the normalization APIs fulfills pretty much the same
job as the src in the symbolization logic. As such, we should order them
consistently with respect to the addresses provided.
With this change we move the argument before the address list.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_output *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_sorted(const blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                       uint32_t pid,
                                                                       const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                       size_t addr_cnt);

commits.commit_title:
Introduce blazesym-c crate

This change moves all C API functionality into the blazesym-c crate in
the existing workspace. Doing so ensures better isolation between the
core Rust part and the C API and it will allow us to version the C API
different from the main Rust crate.

Closes: #344

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_output *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_sorted(const blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                        const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                        size_t addr_cnt,
                                                                        uint32_t pid);

commits.commit_title:
Rename various normalization related types

With upcoming changes our normalization functionality will return file
offsets instead of normalized addresses. That renders a bunch of the
existing names containing "addr" unusable.
Rename all those types, opting for "output" or similar terminology
instead of "addr".

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_output *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_sorted(const struct blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                       const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                       size_t addr_cnt,
                                                                       uint32_t pid);

commits.commit_title:
Rename count -> cnt

We use count and the shorter cnt for the same purposes. Converge on
using only 'cnt' for brevity.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_addrs *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_sorted(const struct blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                      const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                      size_t addr_cnt,
                                                                      uint32_t pid);

commits.commit_title:
Introduce Normalizer type

In the future we may want to support more features in the realm of
address normalization. To make that possible without breaking
compatibility, introduce a Normalizer type that can store configuration,
for example. Having such an object around will also allow us to cache
more state between invocations.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
struct blaze_normalized_user_addrs *blaze_normalize_user_addrs_sorted(const struct blaze_normalizer *normalizer,
                                                                      const uintptr_t *addrs,
                                                                       size_t addr_count,
                                                                       uint32_t pid);

commits.commit_title:
Rename normalize_user_addrs -> normalize_user_addrs_sorted

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>

Stop renaming function arguments in C header

It's unclear why we'd ever opt to use "gecko case" style renaming of
function arguments. Just leave them be.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>

Introduce address normalization C API

This change adds C API bindings for the address normalization
functionality.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>

Introduce normalize::NormalizerOpts

We may reasonably want to make normalization more customizable in the
future. To make that possible without an exponential explosion of new
variant methods on the normalizer, this change introduces an option type
that is to be passed to the method used for address normalization.

Signed-off-by: Daniel M眉ller <deso@posteo.net>
added_functions:
pub unsafe extern "C" fn blaze_normalize_user_addrs_opts(
     normalizer: *const blaze_normalizer,
     pid: u32,
     addrs: *const Addr,
     addr_cnt: usize,
    opts: *const blaze_normalize_opts,
 ) -> *mut blaze_normalized_user_output {
